sentences.english: Perhaps we have the fortune, to meet one day. There's no need for any reticence .
sentences.chinese: 也许我们有缘，相逢某一天，一见如故无庸讳言。

sentences.english: Needless to say, some tongues are more versatile than others.
sentences.chinese: 无庸赘言，有些语言更具多样性。

sentences.english: The importance of talents has been no doubt.
sentences.chinese: 人才的重要性已经无庸赘言。

sentences.english: The inevitable reality is that we get more and more open each day.
sentences.chinese: 我们正一天天变得越来越开放，这是无庸置疑的事实。

sentences.english: It's true that it was handed back to China from Japan.
sentences.chinese: 清乾隆年间由日本传回中国，其真实性无庸置疑。

sentences.english: Today the internet is undoubtedly the best place to search for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 无庸置疑，因特网是如今求职的最佳场所。

sentences.english: There is little doubt about its ambitions.
The truth of this news story is beyond debate.
sentences.chinese: 这则新闻报道的真实性，无庸置辩。

sentences.english: Reagan's success is not in doubt.
sentences.chinese: 里根的成功是无庸置疑的。

definition: to have an audience (with the emperor)
imperial concubine or palace maid/imperial secretary (old)
to obey the Emperor's decree/at your Imperial majesty's command
to send away/to dismiss (servants etc)/to retire from public life
to make a report (to a superior)/to give/to endow/to receive/petition
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
warm room/warm partition of a room
